meanings.definition: To cover or wrap something in a coating or layer.
meanings.sent1: She enjoys enrobing her cupcakes in colorful frosting.
meanings.sent2: The chef is enrobing the truffles in chocolate.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kitten tried enrobing itself in toilet paper.
meanings.sent4: The fog enrobing the city gave it a mysterious aura.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush skillfully enrobed the canvas with vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: The act of covering or wrapping something in a coating or layer.
meanings.sent1: The enrobing of the cake with fondant was beautifully done.
meanings.sent2: The enrobing of the gift in shiny paper made it look festive.
meanings.sent3: The enrobing of the car in snow made it hard to find.
meanings.sent4: The enrobing of the tree roots with moss created a natural look.
meanings.sent5: The enrobing of the building in ivy gave it a charming appearance.
